message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.DB, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses a blockchain sharding protocol that addresses security and performance issues. The main focus is on preventing an adversary from controlling a majority of nodes within a shard and recovering from deadlocks. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the categories of Cryptography and Security (cs.CR), Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC), Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS), Databases (cs.DB), and Systems and Control (cs.SY).
